title: Zoomed In
text:
This page displays zoomed in versions of each historical event.
This way, each event’s impact on the stock market can be better seen.
Maximum Loss:
Dot-Com: -35.7%
2008 Recession: -46.7%
Covid-19 Pandemic: -32%


[1] "GSPC"

title: Events Impacting the S&P 500
text:
The S&P 500 is a critical aspect of today’s economy. Its performance impacts the wellbeing and state of the economy. It is comprised of multiple companies available on the stock market.
Below displayed are historical events affecting the S&P 500 and the overall stock market on a graph.


[1] "GSPC"









Significant events create rapid volatility in the stock market.
However, the stock market tends to reliably rise in the long-term.

| Go to Zoomed Graphs?

title: Sources
text:
The events plotted come from Investopedia data.
The graph was created using the “dpylr”, “ggplot”, and “quantmod” packages.
Quantmod: Pulled stock market data from a data set.
GGPlot: Generated a viewable plot from the data.
Investopedia Event List
